# Signing Membership Agreements

**URL:** https://www.mangomint.com/learn/signing-membership-agreements/

## Category
05 Memberships

## Subcategory
N/A

## Article Content

HOME
MEMBERSHIPS
MEMBERSHIP AGREEMENTS
Signing Membership Agreements
IN THIS ARTICLE
Signing membership agreements
Accessing signed membership agreements
Bypassing membership agreements

Once you’ve added a membership agreement to your membership plan, clients will be required to sign the agreement before they can start a new membership in person and online.

This article covers how to:

Sign membership agreements

Access signed membership agreements

Bypass membership agreements

Link copied
Signing membership agreements

When a client starts a new membership in person that requires an agreement, you can send the client an email with a link to sign the agreement and enter their credit card details for automatic billing.

The membership status will be changed to Waiting on signature. The membership will not become active until the client has signed the agreement, entered their credit card details, and completed the payment.

The membership status will be changed to Past Due if the client does not complete this step within 24 hours. Learn how you can resend the email request to the client if needed.

After a successful payment, the client will receive an email confirmation that includes the details of their membership and a link to download their signed agreement.

When a client starts a new membership online that requires an agreement, they will need to sign the agreement before they can start the membership. After a successful payment, the client will receive an email confirmation that includes the details of their membership and a link to download their signed agreement.

Link copied
Accessing signed membership agreements

To view, print, or download a client’s signed membership agreement, open the client's membership details and select the Agreement tab.

Select Print to print the signed agreement. In the print dialog box, your web browser may also include the option to save the document as a PDF.

Link copied
Bypassing membership agreements

You can enable the Can bypass membership agreements permission for specific staff members. This allows staff, such as business owners or managers, to bypass membership agreements as needed when starting new memberships in person.

When an agreement is bypassed, clients can start their membership immediately without having to sign, which you may choose to allow for repeat clients whom you trust or clients who otherwise don’t need to sign the agreement.

To bypass a membership agreement, enable the Skip signature for membership agreement toggle when starting the membership. Once the agreement is bypassed, you can start the membership as you normally would. The Agreement tab in the client's membership details will show the staff member who bypassed the agreement.

Can't find what you're looking for?

Start a chat with us to talk to a real person and get your questions answered, or browse our on-demand videos.
